revised_title: Comparative Meteorological Observations at Kew, Nertchinsk, and Barnaoul
tldr: This article presents the results of the first year's performance of meteorological instruments at Kew Observatory, comparing them with data from two other stations in Siberia. The author discusses the diurnal variations in temperature, vapor tension, barometer, and humidity at the three stations, highlighting the differences and similarities between them. The author also mentions the future plans for the British Meteorological System, including the establishment of more observatories and the communication of the collected data to the public.
